metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Raphael in House of Hope, when players try to escape it after an alarm goes off
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. CTY_Main_A2. Use ReCon command "oe LOW_HOH_CallRaphael"3. goto -6483.267; 1.69; 2887.848

80.speaker: Raphael
80.text: I cannot lose to you. Not here. Not in my home. I cannot die!

85.speaker: Raphael
85.text: Mephistopheles, hear your son! I am at your mercy - save me!

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *Time slows for a moment, and the air becomes thicker. The master of the house is coming.*
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players react to an initially unseen presence with trepidation - they can sense a change in the air, and feel as if they are being watched. Then smoke materialises and when it clears, Raphael is in the room. Politely threatening.

88.speaker: Raphael
88.text: There are many things in your world that I loathe. Litters of kittens, chattering children - the noise and the chaos of it all.

6.speaker: Raphael
6.text: In my world - in my HOUSE - there is order, and there are rules. You have broken the most important rule of all, and committed the cardinal sin.

81.speaker: Raphael
81.text: You went against your word, and defied our contract.

89.speaker: Raphael
89.text: In doing so, you brought the chaos of your world into mine.

92.speaker: Raphael
92.text: But your intrusion and insolence is not the most disappointing part of this whole affair. Your stupidity is.

20.speaker: Raphael
20.text: I still hold your contract, and your presence here is a violation of Clause Fifteen, Subclause Four.

59.speaker: Raphael
59.text: It is said that hope is a fine breakfast, but a poor supper. Well, the shadows grow long, and the hour is late. It's suppertime.

51.speaker: Raphael
51.text: And I'll sup on your soul.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphel summons flames that consume the playersInternalNodeContext: Gameover

84.speaker: Raphael
84.text: In my world - in my HOUSE - there is order, and there is decorum.

60.speaker: Raphael
60.text: You came here uninvited, and you stole from me.

32.speaker: Raphael
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aura of flames surround him for a moment as his rage simmers up

68.speaker: Player
68.text: You need better staff - Korrilla didn't even try to stop me.

52.speaker: Korrilla
52.text: I didn't need to. It was very entertaining watching you dig your own grave.

50.speaker: Korrilla
50.text: I permitted you the freedom to decide your own fate. You could have been smart, selfless - saved the world.

42.speaker: Korrilla
42.text: Instead, you came here and risked everything.

43.speaker: Raphael
43.text: It's the fatal flaw of mortalkind. Take away their free will, and they call you a tyrant. Allow them to indulge it, and they become tyrants.

35.speaker: Raphael
35.text: You would have been heroes if you'd only dealt fairly with me. Instead, you're not so different to doomed Karsus, over-reaching your limits, and burning your world to ash.

47.speaker: Raphael
47.text: Commander - you can salvage a trophy from these insects when I'm done with them.

18.speaker: Yurgir
18.text: These insects understand the honour of hunters better than you ever will, trickster.

54.speaker: Yurgir
54.text: They helped me to eliminate my prey beneath the shadowlands. Prey that you hoped I would never find.

53.speaker: Yurgir
53.text: And that's why I helped them find your home.

56.speaker: Raphael
56.text: You did what? I will make you suffer torments so vile, the hells themselves will shudder to see them.
56.context: NodeContext: quietly threatening, with heavy emphasis on 'what'

75.speaker: Raphael
75.text: And whatever torments I invent for Yurgir, I will perfect in the centuries I spend toying with your soul.
75.context: NodeContext: addressed to player, emphasis on 'your' as he's just switched his attention from an NPC to the player

21.speaker: Yurgir
21.text: These insects struck me down beneath the shadowlands. They are worthy opponents.

44.speaker: Yurgir
44.text: Their skulls will make fine trophies.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Afraid to fight me alone, Raphael?

58.speaker: Raphael
58.text: You mistake efficiency and strategy for cowardice. It will be your last mistake.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Fight with me, Yurgir, or I'll strike you down again.

65.speaker: Yurgir
65.text: To stand against a devil in his own home. That takes courage. I'm with you.

5.speaker: Raphael
5.text: How tiresome. Am I to understand that you wish to die with them?
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to orthonNodeContext: addressed to orthon, who has just turned on him - impatient and petulant rather than rage

8.speaker: Yurgir
8.text: I wish to fight with them.

74.speaker: Raphael
74.text: It's all the same in the end.

7.speaker: Yurgir
7.text: Few have bested me once. None have bested me twice. I stand with Raphael.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Join the winning side - Raphael doesn't stand a chance against me.

0.speaker: Yurgir
0.text: You overestimate your abilities. I stand with Raphael.

33.speaker: Raphael
33.text: If you have any last words, make it quick. It will only take a moment to finish you.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Wait - please. I have one final proposition.

63.speaker: Raphael
63.text: As do I, little mouse. Your flesh, my supper. Your blood, my wine. Your soul, my plaything.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: That's twice as long as Haarlep said it takes to finish you.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I've been hoping to kill you ever since I met you.

49.speaker: Raphael
49.text: Hope. It always burns you in the end, little mouse.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: If I die, Baldur's Gate is doomed.

93.speaker: Raphael
93.text: Such a shame. I'll make sure you live long enough to watch it burn.

82.speaker: Raphael
82.text: And whether it takes a hundred years or a thousand, the Crown will be mine eventually. My time will come. Your time is over, little mouse.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: If you kill me, you'll never get the Crown.

31.speaker: Raphael
31.text: Wrong. I might have to wait another hundred years - maybe a thousand - but my time will come. Your time is over, little mouse.

34.speaker: Raphael
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael transforms into his devil form,towering ower the players who react in horror

70.speaker: Raphael
70.text: No words? No matter. You will scream before the end, little mouse.

46.speaker: Yurgir
46.text: These insects tricked me beneath the shadowlands.

55.speaker: Yurgir
55.text: I'll make a necklace of their cunning tongues.

17.speaker: Yurgir
17.text: I met these insects once before, beneath the shadowlands. I did not expect to see them again.

64.speaker: Hope
64.text: WRONG WRONG WRONG. They will save their world and smash you to smithereens.

76.speaker: Raphael
76.text: It's this charming naivety that makes your company such a joy to me, Hope. I'll even forgive this little rebellion once you're suitably chastised.

27.speaker: Hope
27.text: This isn't a rebellion, it's a revolt. I'M REVOLTING.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Your house is in disarray - the guards couldn't stop me from freeing Hope.

9.speaker: Hope
9.text: SISTER OH SISTER I'VE WEPT AND I'VE CRIED, BUT ALL WOULD BE WELL IF YOU WERE BY MY SIDE

38.speaker: Raphael
38.text: Oh, Hope, you are such a piteous thing. All it takes is a crumb from the table, and you forget the centuries of starvation. This insolence has earned you centuries more.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to Hope, across the room

94.speaker: Raphael
94.text: Korrilla - tell our unwelcome guest about your role in their tragic downfall.
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning to address Korrilla, close by his sideNodeContext: to a faithful warlock

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Korrilla - this is your chance to be free. Help me take him down.

90.speaker: Korrilla
90.text: You think I'm on your side?

57.speaker: Korrilla
57.text: The only reason you're here is because Raphael allowed you to be.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: It's over, Raphael. You can't stop me.

28.speaker: Hope
28.text: I AM NOT ENTIRELY SURE THAT HE WON'T

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Let me leave. There doesn't need to be any more bloodshed.

11.speaker: Raphael
11.text: You've given me no other choice. I offered you liberty, and you've chosen death.
